business.headline: Meesho vs Aequs vs Vidya Wire: Which IPO offers the best value?Meesho IPO was subscribed 2.46 times on Day 1, with retail investors bidding 4.13 times their quota. Aequs saw even stronger retail interest at 12.16 times, pushing its overall subscription to 3.56 times. Vidya Wires, a smaller issue, was subscribed 3.16 times overall.
1,232 IndiGo flight cancelled in November, aviation regulator probesThe Directorate General of Civil Aviation sought reasons from the airline over the cancellations of flight and delays in time.

EPFO ends Aadhaar–UAN extension: Will employers now face stricter ECR rules?EPFO confirms there will be no further deadline extensions for Aadhaar seeding with UAN, affecting ECR filing from November 2025.
Sensex, Nifty close flat as falling rupee sparks concern on Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 31.46 points to close at 85,106.81, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 46.20 points to end at 25,986.00.

Transferring money to family to save tax: Smart move or legal risk?On the surface, it looks like easy tax efficiency. But experts say that while transferring money within the family is legal, using it as a tax-saving tool is far more complicated and can even invite scrutiny if not handled correctly.

Is a Rs 1.5 lakh monthly salary in metro cities really enough? CA answersA high salary may create the impression of financial stability, but metro expenses tell a different story. A chartered accountant has explained how a Rs 1.5 lakh monthly income can shrink rapidly once daily costs and EMIs are taken into account.

Aequs IPO fully subscribed: Is it a buy or skip?Aequs IPO has seen full subscription within hours of opening, drawing considerable interest from retail investors. Experts discuss the company's prospects, valuation, and investor considerations.

Are gold and silver heading towards record highs this week?Gold and silver prices in India have climbed sharply as the rupee lost ground against the US dollar, with market observers attributing these patterns to global economic indicators and currency stress.
Will the EPS-95 minimum pension be raised from Rs 1,000 to Rs 7,500?As pensioner groups renew their demand for a hike, is the government finally considering raising the EPS-95 minimum pension?

If it was forged, why not tell us?: Man refutes insurer's fraud tag on sister's claimWhen a dangerous blood clot hospitalised Purvi Gupta, her family expected their insurer to stand by them. Instead, they recount months of bewildering paperwork, escalating confusion, and a sudden fraud tag they insist was never disclosed. This week's 'Claim Denied' story follows a family left stunned and fighting for answers.

USD vs INR: Why is Rupee falling constantlyA weaker rupee makes imports more expensive, increases inflation risks and raises costs for companies dependent on foreign goods, especially fuel and machinery.

December 15 ITR deadline: Do you need to pay the 3rd advance tax instalment?The deadline for the third advance tax instalment for FY26 is approaching. Here's what taxpayers need to know about who must pay, what counts as advance tax liability, and the consequences of missing this important date.

Meesho IPO retail portion fully subscribed. Check latest GMP, total subscriptionA fully subscribed retail book and a steady Rs 49 GMP have set strong early cues for Meesho's IPO, with eyes now on whether institutional demand will push valuations higher.

Rupee in freefall, slides past 90 against US dollar: What next?The key question now is whether the rupee stabilises or slides deeper. All eyes are on the RBI's policy signal, foreign flows, and any movement in the India–US trade talks.

Meesho IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check strength and key risksMeesho IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 5,421.20 crore. This includes a fresh issue of 38.29 crore shares worth Rs 4,250 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 10.55 crore shares worth Rs 1,171.20 crore.

Rupee hits all-time low, slips past 90 against US dollar for first timeThe rupee's slide to 90 heightens cost pressures for households and businesses, fuels import-driven inflation risks and leaves markets looking to the RBI for stronger support.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as rupee hits all-time lowThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 281.56 points to 84,856.71, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 105.10 points to 25,927.10 as of 9:40 am.

Delhi startup founder shuts down company after 'frivolous complaint' by clientAccording to its LinkedIn profile, Wherehouse was founded in 2021 as a supply chain intelligence company, helping brands move closer to their customers, enabling faster and more efficient deliveries, and driving business growth.

RBI MPC meet begins today: Will rate cuts finally return?In its October meeting, the MPC kept the repo rate steady at 5.5% for a fourth straight time. RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra had then said that inflation had moderated sharply, giving the committee confidence to maintain its stance.

EU to push ahead with plan to use Russia's frozen assets for Ukraine: ReportEU leaders agreed in October to meet Ukraine's "pressing financial needs" for the next two years but stopped short of endorsing a plan to use 140 billion euros ($162 billion) in frozen Russian sovereign assets in Europe as a loan for Kyiv, due to concerns raised by Belgium.

entertainment.headline: Tere Ishk Mein box office Day 6: Dhanush-Kriti's film hits Rs 100 crore globally Aanand L Rai's Tere Ishk Mein, starring Dhanush and Kriti Sanon, saw its box office numbers drop on Day 6 but managed to cross the Rs 100 crore mark globally in its first week, making it Dhanush's biggest Hindi film hit.

Rashmika addresses wedding rumours with Vijay Deverakonda, prefers privacy Rashmika Mandanna broke her silence on the ongoing rumours about her wedding with Vijay Deverakonda in a recent interview. The two reportedly got engaged in a private ceremony in October.

Travis Kelce says he's had no arguments with Taylor, George Clooney offers advice Travis Kelce recently weighed in on his relationship with fiancee Taylor Swift. The Kansas City star revealed that he never argued with the singer.

Deepika Padukone recreates Orry pose with Ranveer Singh at his cousin's wedding At Ranveer Singh's cousin's wedding in Goa, Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh were seen performing the popular Orry pose, with the moment captured and shared by Orry himself. The candid video quickly gained attention on social media.

Explained: What The Family Man 3 reveals about Tamil diaspora in Moreh The Family Man 3 portrays the Tamil diaspora's history in Moreh, Manipur. The narrative highlights displacement, trade challenges, and cultural resilience amid regional unrest.

Paranormal Activity 8 in the works, James Wan joins as producer for 1st time A new installment in the Paranormal Activity franchise is in development, with horror filmmaker James Wan joining as producer alongside Jason Blum following the merger of Atomic Monster and Blumhouse.

Millie Bobby Brown, Jake Bongiovi share glimpses of first holiday with daughter Millie Bobby Brown has offered a candid look into her life with husband Jake Bongiovi and their adopted daughter, marking the family's first holiday season together. .

Jonas Brothers imprint hands, feet at TCL Theatre as they mark 20 years in music The Jonas Brothers celebrated a career milestone on Wednesday, leaving their handprints and footprints at the iconic TCL Theatre in Hollywood as they mark 20 years as a band.

Madhuri Dixit says sons need not act; can be YouTubers like Dr Nene Actor Madhuri Dixit reflects on her family's engagement with YouTube, her husband's public profile, and her children's comfort on digital platforms, as she prepares for her latest series release.

Arijit Singh tops Spotify Wrapped 2025 In India, also features in Global Top 10 Spotify Wrapped 2025 reveals Arijit Singh as India's top artist for the seventh consecutive year, with notable entries from independent musicians and a resurgence of older film albums in streaming charts. Pritam, Shreya Ghoshal and Mohit Suri also featured on the charts.

Ranveer Singh turns emotional as he walks his cousin down the aisle. Watch Bollywood actors Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone recently attended a family wedding in Goa, engaging actively in the ceremonies and garnering attention from relatives and guests. Videos from the event have surfaced online, capturing the couple's participation in traditional rituals.

Ready or Not 2 trailer: Samara Weaving returns to gore-splattered, horror-comedy The trailer for 'Ready or Not 2: Here I Come' was released on November 28, 2025. The film promises a violent and thrilling continuation featuring Samara Weaving, Elijah Wood, Sarah Michelle Gellar and others.

Shabana Azmi shares joyful clip of Vidya, Divya, Sandhya owning the dance floor Shabana Azmi's recent social media posts reveal a joyful Diwali celebration with her circle of friends and colleagues, highlighting the camaraderie and appreciation within the group.

Aamir Khan and Ajay Devgn keen on Hindi remake of Mohanlal's Thudarum Director Tharun Moorthy confirms that discussions are in progress to remake the Malayalam hit Thudarum in Hindi, with major Bollywood studios and actors showing interest.

Malaika Arora calls out society's double standards: Men move on, women are judged Actor Malaika Arora highlighted societal double standards around divorce and remarriage. She pointed out how men face less judgement than women for similar personal choices.

Yami Gautam awaits husband's film Dhurandhar, director praises her Haq role Filmmaker Aditya Dhar praised his actor-wife Yami Gautam's acting in 'Haq' in an X post on Wednesday. While expressing her gratitude, Yami showcased excitement for Dhar's upcoming film 'Dhurandhar'.

Long live Dev saheb: Shatrughan Sinha pays tribute on Dev Anand's death anniversary Shatrughan Sinha paid a heartfelt tribute to Dev Anand on the legend's 13th death anniversary, recalling the life-changing advice the actor once gave him. Sharing old memories, Sinha said Dev Anand taught him to embrace his natural features and turn "minus points" into strengths.

Kartik Aaryan set to perform for free at a sangeet. Here's why Bollywood actor Kartik Aaryan's dance rehearsal for an upcoming sangeet ceremony has captured social media attention, with fans commenting on his moves and the festive spirit.

Rakul Preet talks about Jackky Bhagnani's financial struggles after Bade Miyan Rakul Preet Singh has addressed rumours surrounding Pooja Entertainment's financial troubles, clarifying that the company is not shutting down despite losses after Bade Miyan Chote Miyan. She said sensational reporting exaggerated the situation and that financial ups and downs are common in the film industry.

general news.headline: World exclusive: Russian President Putin speaks to India Today ahead of India visitThe interview, filmed inside the historic Ekaterina (Catherine) Hall of the Kremlin, was conducted by India Today Group's Anjana Om Kashyap and Geeta Mohan.

Pak to sell national carrier PIA for IMF loans, Munir's Fauji firm among biddersPakistan's sale of its flag carrier PIA is its first major privatisation in two decades. The divestment comes because of an IMF bailout condition. With four bidders, including military-led Fauji Fertiliser, the auction on December 23 is key for a debt-ridden economy and its crippled national carrier.

Putin's 2-day India visit begins today: BrahMos, trade, defence deals on agendaVladimir Putin is visiting India on an invitation by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, and it is the first since the Russian leader launched his war against Ukraine.

Trump administration orders tougher vetting for H-1B visa applicants: ReportH-1B visas are lifelines for US tech companies that draw heavily from India and China. Many industry leaders backed Donald Trump last year, betting on a business-friendly environment even as immigration rules tightened.

Finisher who? Raipur loss highlights India's glaring ODI weaknessSouth Africa's record chase of 359 exposed India's inability to push harder with the bat in the death overs. Hundreds from Virat Kohli and Ruturaj Gaikwad went in vain with at least 20–30 runs left on the field in the first innings.

India should work to get S-500 system: Patna-born Russian MLA on Putin's visitIndia-origin Russian MLA Abhay Singh said that New Delhi should seek the S-500 air-defence system from Moscow as President Vladimir Putin is scheduled to arrive for the India-Russia summit expected to focus on defence, energy and labour mobility.

Mecca's Kaaba seen like a bright light in stunning picture from spaceUsing a high-resolution Nikon camera, astronaut Don Pettit, renowned for his artistic space photography during his fourth ISS mission, captured the scene from the station's cupola window.

ICAR's servers get breached one after another. Whiff of a scam in data wipeout?Sensitive recruitment and research records from India's top agricultural research body, the ICAR, disappeared first from the server in New Delhi and then from the backup device in Hyderabad earlier this year. Defying data-security protocols and due procedures, ICAR's silence and delayed enquiry have only intensified suspicions of a deeper cover-up behind the twin server wipe-outs.
I am a doctor and here's what caring for older patients has taught me about fallsA geriatrician shares her experience with older patients about healthy ageing - physically, mentally, and emotionally.

Hegseth put troops at risk by sharing strike details on Signal: Pentagon watchdogA Pentagon watchdog says Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth risked US troops by sharing strike details on Signal. The review found policy violations and sparked bipartisan concern over mishandled military information.

Doctor who sold ketamine to Friends star Matthew Perry gets 30 months in prisonA Los Angeles doctor who admitted selling ketamine to Matthew Perry before the Friends star's fatal overdose was sentenced to two and a half years in prison, with the judge saying he exploited Perry's addiction.

Mosque inside Kolkata airport kicks up storm. How did it actually get there?The century-old Bankra mosque, which is situated a few hundred metres from the secondary runway of Kolkata airport, has sparked a political row. BJP leaders have flagged safety and security concerns regarding the mosque. How did the mosque come to be in the airport in the first place?

Ranveer Singh turns emotional as he walks his cousin down the aisle. WatchBollywood actors Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone recently attended a family wedding in Goa, engaging actively in the ceremonies and garnering attention from relatives and guests. Videos from the event have surfaced online, capturing the couple's participation in traditional rituals.

Nitin Gadkari, riding in flex-fuel car, explains how it will curb pollutionGadkari said that the car, while under use, creates 60 per cent electricity. So, effectively, the actual cost of a flex-fuel car running on ethanol will cost a person around Rs 25 per litre.

House Democrats release new photos and videos from Epstein's private islandDemocratic lawmakers have released new photos and videos from Jeffrey Epstein's private island. The release intensifies calls for transparency amid ongoing trafficking and abuse investigations.

Flower must be cared for: Khamenei defends hijab, blames West for harming womenIran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has claimed Western capitalist systems reduce women to objects and erode their basic dignity. He added that in the West, women are used for "material exploitation".

How a freedom fighter became India's first woman CA: A remarkable life storyR Sivabhogam became India's first woman Chartered Accountant in 1933. Her achievement challenged gender norms and paved the way for women in finance across India.

Mentally unstable man: Imran Khan blasts Asim Munir in explosive attackPakistan's former PM Imran Khan, held in Adiala Jail, accused Army Chief Asim Munir of "disastrous" policies, deliberately fueling Afghanistan tensions, worsening terrorism, and subjecting him to solitary confinement and psychological torture.

74,000 Indian students are leaving UK. Are stricter visa rules the culprit?Stricter UK visa and dependant rules are prompting a growing number of Indian students to leave the country, raising fresh concerns for universities heavily reliant on international fee revenue. New ONS data showing 74,000 Indian departures in 2025 signals a shifting trend that could reshape the future of UK higher education.

Video: Gujarat vlogger killed in fatal bike crash while filming reelCCTV footage from Anuvrat Dwar Over Bridge captured the sequence as Prince lost control of his speeding bike, fell onto the road, and the motorcycle continued forward before crashing into a divider.

Explained: What The Family Man 3 reveals about Tamil diaspora in MorehThe Family Man 3 portrays the Tamil diaspora's history in Moreh, Manipur. The narrative highlights displacement, trade challenges, and cultural resilience amid regional unrest.

Hiring freeze, lean manpower: Pilot body slams IndiGo for flight cancellationsThe Federation of India Pilots has raised concerns over IndiGo's ongoing flight cancellations, attributing the disruption to the airline's hiring freeze and lean manpower strategy.

No one will have to go to Bangladesh: Mamata Banerjee amid SIR fearsWest Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee launched a strong attack on the Centre over the rollout of SIR, alleging it was implemented "cleverly" ahead of elections under the direction of Union Home Minister Amit Shah. She accused the Centre of blocking funds, centralising taxes, and using bulldozers and misinformation tactics.

Pakistan-born US man arrested with guns, martyrdom mass-shooting planPolice arrested former University of Delaware student Luqmaan Khan after finding guns, body armor and a manifesto outlining plans to kill all, the New York Post reported. The FBI later uncovered more unregistered weapons.

Legendary producer AVM Saravanan, pillar of Tamil cinema, dies at 86AVM Saravanan, a leading producer in Tamil cinema and the head of AVM Productions, died on Thursday at the age of 86 due to age-related ailments. The film fraternity, family, and admirers are gathering to pay their respects to the legend.

Tere Ishk Mein box office Day 6: Dhanush-Kriti's film hits Rs 100 crore globallyAanand L Rai's Tere Ishk Mein, starring Dhanush and Kriti Sanon, saw its box office numbers drop on Day 6 but managed to cross the Rs 100 crore mark globally in its first week, making it Dhanush's biggest Hindi film hit.

sports.headline: A Virat Kohli ton finally isn't enough: India's 7-year unbeaten ODI streak ends Virat Kohli's superb 102 in Raipur could not save India, who suffered their first ODI defeat with a Kohli century in nearly seven years. His stand with Ruturaj Gaikwad set up 358, but South Africa chased it down to level the series.

What Gautam Gambhir told Ruturaj Gaikwad after giving No.4 role? India batter reveals India batter Ruturaj Gaikwad revealed the message he got from Gautam Gambhir after being told to play the role of No.4 during the South Africa ODIs. Gaikwad hit his maiden ODI hundred during the match in Raipur.

Ashes live score, pink-ball Test Day 1: Teams eye early advantage in Brisbane Ashes 2025, 2nd Test Day 1 Live Score and Updates: After a rather short affair in Perth, Australia and England arrive in Brisbane for the pink-ball Test. England had their moments in the first game but it was all Australia in the end. Given their near-perfect record in pink-ball Tests, the Aussies start as the favourites in the contest. Can Ben Stokes and his side spring a surprise?

Finisher who? Raipur loss highlights India's glaring ODI weakness South Africa's record chase of 359 exposed India's inability to push harder with the bat in the death overs. Hundreds from Virat Kohli and Ruturaj Gaikwad went in vain with at least 20–30 runs left on the field in the first innings.

Leader and mentor: Virat Kohli's double role in Raipur earns praise from Gavaskar Virat Kohli did more than score runs in the Raipur ODI. He steadied a nervous Ruturaj Gaikwad after a brutal first-ball bouncer from Marco Jansen, helping him settle before he struck his maiden ODI hundred. Sunil Gavaskar praised Kohli's leadership and mentorship during the key partnership.

Jadeja the culprit? KL Rahul admits late-overs slump as India fail to defend 359 IND vs SA, 2nd ODI: South Africa's record chase exposed India's lack of a finishing kick and the impact of relentless dew, prompting KL Rahul to admit his side left crucial runs on the field in Raipur.

Virat Kohli, Ruturaj Gaikwad tons not enough as SA chase 359 in dewy Raipur India vs South Africa, 2nd ODI: South Africa scripted the joint-highest successful chase by a visiting team in ODIs in India when they gunned down 359 on a dewy evening. India finished second-best in Raipur despite hundreds from Virat Kohli and Ruturaj Gaikwad.

Sports Minister leads talks to end Indian football impasse, confronts AIFF on issues Sports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya met AIFF officials, club representatives and prospective bidders to address Indian football's financial and structural crisis. He questioned leadership lapses, heard stakeholder concerns and promised a plan to end the ongoing stalemate.

Smoke shisha, talk cricket: MS Dhoni's open-door CSK routine revealed by ex-teammate Michael Hussey lifts the lid on MS Dhoni's relaxed and welcoming team culture at CSK, sharing stories of open-room hangouts, shisha sessions and Dhoni's surprising lack of keeping practice.

Irritated by media attention, Stokes snaps at Aussie reporter over e-scooter row Ashes: A tense standoff unfolded between Ben Stokes and a reporter in Brisbane after the England captain and teammates were questioned about not wearing helmets while riding e-scooters.

Jadeja the culprit? KL Rahul admits late-overs slump as India fail to defend 359 IND vs SA, 2nd ODI: South Africa's record chase exposed India's lack of a finishing kick and the impact of relentless dew, prompting KL Rahul to admit his side left crucial runs on the field in Raipur.

Virat Kohli, Ruturaj Gaikwad tons not enough as SA chase 359 in dewy Raipur India vs South Africa, 2nd ODI: South Africa scripted the joint-highest successful chase by a visiting team in ODIs in India when they gunned down 359 on a dewy evening. India finished second-best in Raipur despite hundreds from Virat Kohli and Ruturaj Gaikwad.

Sports Minister leads talks to end Indian football impasse, confronts AIFF on issues Sports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya met AIFF officials, club representatives and prospective bidders to address Indian football's financial and structural crisis. He questioned leadership lapses, heard stakeholder concerns and promised a plan to end the ongoing stalemate.

Smoke shisha, talk cricket: MS Dhoni's open-door CSK routine revealed by ex-teammate Michael Hussey lifts the lid on MS Dhoni's relaxed and welcoming team culture at CSK, sharing stories of open-room hangouts, shisha sessions and Dhoni's surprising lack of keeping practice.

Irritated by media attention, Stokes snaps at Aussie reporter over e-scooter row Ashes: A tense standoff unfolded between Ben Stokes and a reporter in Brisbane after the England captain and teammates were questioned about not wearing helmets while riding e-scooters.

Aiden Markram first visiting SA opener to hit hundred vs India in a decadeAiden Markram scored a superb 110 to become the first South African opener in ten years to make an ODI century in India. His dismissal marked a turning point as India regained control in a high-scoring match.

Virat Kohli's 53rd ODI century and roadmap to 2027 World CupIND vs SA: Virat Kohli scored his 53rd ODI hundred in Raipur on Wednesday. The former captain hit back-to-back hundreds against South Africa, raising the hopes of his place in the 2027 ODI World Cup squad.

Ashes 2025-26: All you need to know about the pink-ball Test in BrisbaneAustralia aim to extend their dominance in day-night Tests as England looks to rebound from a heavy Perth defeat. With pitch conditions, twilight swing, and late-week storms in play, the Gabba pink-ball clash promises a decisive early twist in the 2025 Ashes.

T20 specialist Mohit Sharma announces retirement from all formats of cricketMohit Sharma, 37, retired from all formats of cricket on December 3. The former Delhi Capitals and Chennai Super Kings bowler made an impact as a death bowler in T20 cricket.

Rinku Singh deserves a place: Fans slam batter's snub from IND vs SA T20I seriesIND vs SA: Rinku Singh's exclusion from India's T20I squad for the South Africa series has sparked widespread fan outrage. With the T20 World Cup 2026 looming, many believe his strike-rate and finishing skills made him indispensable — yet he remains overlooked.

Virat Kohli addicted to scoring centuries: Cricket world celebrates 53rd ODI 100IND vs SA: Virat Kohli's back-to-back centuries have reasserted his dominance in ODI cricket at the perfect moment. With a World Cup year approaching, the King looks firmly back in his most unstoppable rhythm.

Rohit Sharma unveils India's new jersey for 2026 T20 World CupRohit Sharma unveiled India's new jersey for the 2026 T20 World Cup during the mid-innings break of the second ODI against South Africa in Raipur on Wednesday.

Shubman Gill and Hardik Pandya return as India announce T20I squadIndia vs South Africa: The BCCI announced a 15-man squad for a five-match T20I series, which will be played from December 9 to 19. Shubman Gill returned as vice-captain, but his availability will be subject to fitness.

Queensland minister slams Ben Stokes & co for driving e-scooter without helmetsLocal authorities and officials in Queensland have called out England cricket stars Ben Stokes, Mark Wood and Jamie Smith after they were seen riding electric two-wheelers without helmets in Brisbane, despite local regulations mandating protective gear.

Ruturaj Gaikwad's maiden ODI hundred draws praise for Gautam Gambhir. Here's whyRuturaj Gaikwad's first ODI hundred becomes a validation of head coach Gautam Gambhir's selection strategy, with cricketing voices praising the clarity of roles that enabled the batter to excel in an unfamiliar position.

Watch: Ruturaj Gaikwad narrowly escapes being hit by Kohli's fierce straight hitRuturaj Gaikwad narrowly escaped injury from a powerful shot by Virat Kohli during their record partnership in the second ODI against South Africa. The duo added 195 runs for the third wicket to stabilise India's innings and set a new highest partnership record against South Africa.

Virat Kohli Hits 53rd ODI Century vs South Africa; Ruturaj Gaikwad Slams Maiden TonIn this Special Report, India Today's Consulting Editor (Sports) Nikhil Naaz reports on Virat Kohli's record-breaking 53rd ODI century against South Africa in Raipur. Kohli, scoring his 84th international hundred, built a match-winning partnership with Ruturaj Gaikwad, who registered his maiden ODI ton. Naaz highlights Kohli's 'unbelievable' consistency and addresses speculations about his Test return. Quoting Kohli, Naaz confirms the star batter's decision to stick to one format: 'I'm focusing on the ODI format, that's the only format that I continue to play.' The report analyzes how the duo rescued India from a precarious 60 for 2 to dominate the 2nd ODI.

Virat Kohli roars again, hits back-to-back hundreds vs South AfricaIndia vs South Africa: Star India batter Virat Kohli extended his 50-over purple patch characteristically, scoring his 53rd ODI hundred and his second in succession against South Africa at the Shaheed Veer Narayan Singh International Stadium in Raipur on Wednesday.

Ruturaj converts rare opportunity, smashes maiden ODI hundred in RaipurIndia vs South Africa: Ruturaj Gaikwad hit his maiden ODI hundred on Wednesday, bringing up the landmark in just 77 deliveries. The Chennai Super Kings captain stitched a 190-plus partnership with Virat Kohli in Raipur.

Jarmanpreet Singh, Navneet Kaur to lead SG Pipers in HIL season 2SG Pipers have revealed their captaincy choices for Season 2 of the Hockey India League, appointing Jarmanpreet Singh to helm the men's squad and retaining Navneet Kaur for the women's side. Australians Ky Willott and Kaitlin Nobbs step in as vice-captains, as both teams look to rebound from last year's campaigns.

The Coaching Quandary: Why Indian Hockey keeps failing the long-term vision testIndian hockey still seems to be stuck in terms of fixing their long-term vision when it comes to coaches. With Harendra Singh leaving the Women's team post, Hockey India are set to make an interesting call and go for former coach Sjoerd Marijne.

NZ vs WI, 1st Test: Jacob Duffy takes five as New Zealand seize control on Day 2Jacob Duffy took his maiden five-wicket haul to put New Zealand in control of the first Test against West Indies. His spell helped bundle out the visitors for 167 as the Kiwis finished the day with a lead of 96 runs.

Why senior pros are retiring from IPL ahead of 2026 mini auctionJP Duminy explained why senior pros like Glenn Maxwell and Faf du Plessis have decided to pull out of the IPL 2026 auction. The duo have been joined by the likes of Andre Russell and others.

Cummins fit for Gabba Test? Steve Smith tight-lipped on Australia's playing XIAshes: Pat Cummins may return as Australia's captain for the second Test against England, with stand-in skipper Steve Smith indicating that the fast bowler has a genuine chance of featuring in the pink-ball match.

Virat Kohli leapfrogs Gill in ICC ODI rankings, Rohit maintains top spotVirat Kohli went past India captain Shubman Gill in the latest ICC ODI rankings while Rohit Sharma maintained his grip at the top. Kohli scored a brilliant 135 against South Africa in Ranchi in his return game.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
